comments:
Build ID: 3.3

Steps To Reproduce:
eclipse doesn't show/add jars from IBM JRE 6 when we do preferences>JAVA>Installed JREs and point to the IBM JRE6.  You will see the JRE System libraries is empty.




More information:
This problem happens to eclipse 3.3.  3.2.1 works fine and it works fine when points to IBM JRE 5.

My ref:00302959
This is a critical defect for us.  Please fix it as soon as possible.  Please contact me if you need more information.

Works for me. I'm using  I20070523-0010, and

java version "1.6.0-internal"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 20070215_01)
IBM J9 VM (build 2.4, J2RE 1.6.0 IBM J9 2.4 Windows XP x86-32 jvmwi3260-20070214
_11522 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20070214_11522_lHdSMR
JIT  - dev_20070214_1800_dev
GC   - 20070208_AA)

I point at the 'sdk' directory and the jars show up.

Darin,

Thanks for trying it out.  Which version of JRE do you use to run eclipse?  I am using the below 1.5 JRE.  Do you think it matters?  Will you please try using the 1.5 JRE?

Thanks,

Jason


java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20070413 (SR5))
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20070413 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20070406_12209_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20070406_2120_r8
GC   - 20070328_AA)
JCL  - 20070412
Works when I run Eclipse on IBM5.0 (sr5) or IBM6.0.

Hi Darin,

Thanks again.

We use the 3.3M7 driver.  I downloaded it from eclipse, used my JRE 5 to run it and I could reproduce the problem.  Would you mind to download the M7 driver and try again so that we can isolate the problem?

Thanks,

Jason
Also works on M7 for me. What do you see? Any error messages on the screen or in the .log?

Hi Darin,

Sorry.  I should have looked at the log earlier.  Here are the exceptions.  I don't see any error dialog in the GUI.  I only see the jar table is empty.

Thanks,

Jason
